Articles.Content:
The orbital darkness calculator I've been using for ages is down:

http://www.prism.gatech.edu/~bnichols8/projects/kspdarkness/main.shtml

 

Does anyone know of any website or tool that does the same?

 

I can do this by hand, there's half-decent instructions on the wiki, but it's fairly laborious.

Ampyear has a calculator https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/114991-141-ampyear-main-reserve-power-manager-v1520-16th-march-2018/

Also this remote tech helper https://ryohpops.github.io/kspRemoteTechPlanner/

You can also use the 'wayback machine', some kind of internet archives which will bring up this snapshot of the website:

https://web.archive.org/web/20180225003421/http://www.prism.gatech.edu/~bnichols8/projects/kspdarkness/main.shtml

Right-click on a free space of the website -> save page as... an save a copy of the website on your local computer. Whenever you need the calculater again, you can use your local copy
